title: 26000 Bells of Hanuman Sculpture
description: Shri Hanuman 25ft Suspended Sculpture made of 26000 Bells created by Charuvi Agrawal. The 25 feet sculpture of Shri Hanuman made of 26,000 bells which is a unique combination of art and technology and also a humble effort in portray the depth, splendor and the meaning of the verses.

title: People's Revolution
description:
People's revolution:
https://vimeo.com/205052363
Interactive Installation 
Jayaprakash Narayan Museum 
Lucknow (2016) , 7 x 15 feet

Charuvi Agrawal Presents A Tour De Force For The JayprakashNarayan Museum In Lucknow – “Thali Bajao Praxinoscope  – The Peoples Revolution”
 
Jean Baudrillard said that the simulacra shows the truth that there is none. A revolution sounds life changing, defining the pages of history and is the culmination of efforts for a cause. Charuvi’s Thali Bajao revolving praxinoscope attempts to recreate the flash in history which is the ‘Maut Ka Ghanta’, Jayprakash Narayans revolution tactic employed immediately post Indira Gandhi’s declaration of emergency in 1975. In that flash, at exactly 9 pm each night, the revolutionaries came out to make a horrendous din using utensils and common metalwares, to remind Mrs. Gandhi, that ‘Total Revolution’ is coming. 
The 8 foot tall revolving sculpture was made using clay, fiberglass, metal, plaster, acrylic over 11 weeks in a makeshift workshop. At a glance, the artwork shows layers of cylindrical homes stacked on each other with commoners lining the burnt umber coloured streets. Kept on a rotating platform and with perfectly calibrated strobe lights the sculpture is designed to take you into the true essence of what it is. 
Once the sculpture starts it’s rotations, the strobe lights and unique geometry of the artwork create a praxinoscopic illusion of reality. The sculpture itself and each and every uniquely designed and hand-painted  figurine comes alive, enveloping the viewer into that era, bringing that energy and fear which was what the revolutionary wanted each one to feel. It transports you alongside the youth, pedestrians and luminaries in Patna and lets you feel the true pulse of Bihar, two generations ago. 
Blending art and technology, Charuvi creates yet another emotionally stimulating project which truly transcends into a living spectacle. Her passion to entice the viewer in rapture and awe can be seen with this marvelous execution of an extremely complex artwork.

title: Elephant’s Stance of Offering a Lotus to Lord Vishnu, from the Puranic Legend “Gajendra Moksha”
Kaavad - 16 Feet Story Book
description: Inspired by the traditional folkart from Rajasthan - Kavad, also called "God Boxes". A regular kavad is around 6 inches in height with illustrated panels. Charuvi created a life size hand painted, wooden shrine with shelf’s, on the lines of cabinet of curiosity with real physical belongings. The installation invites the user to an enchanted discovery of the mystical mythological assets.

title: Kaivalya - Suspended Sculpture
description:
Charuvi, this time decided to recreate the elephant’s stance of offering a lotus to Lord Vishnu, from the Puranic legend “Gajendra Moksha” or “The Liberation of Gajendra”.

Kaivalya, the notable character from the Puran is a stunning 12 footer, 1.5 ton, brought to life using ghungroos suspended on fish cords.

This sculptures is made of material that hold a significant value in Indian culture. Ghungroos are used to evoke optimism through a medium that is universally known for its positive vibe: music. Kaivalya was created with the intention to emit a rhythmic sound of the legendary Gajendra Stuti (hymn sung by Gajendra in praise of the lord), thus heightening the experience of viewing the installation.
